Title: Products should be CRUD-able
Description:
As a user
I want to manage products
So that our other users can order MANY things (and not just teddy bears).

Title: Products are sortable
Description:
As a purchaser
I want to be able to sort product listings
So that I can put the cheapest ones first

```
/products?sort=name // Sort ascending
/products?sort=-name // Sort descending
/products?sort=price // Sort ascending
/products?sort=-price // Sort descending
```

Title: Querying for a bank that doesn't exist is borked
Banks can present a transaction history
Description:
As a purchaser
I want to see a transaction history
So I can see where all my money went

Title: Purchases cannot be made that would cause the bank to drop below $0
Description:
As a user
I want to forbid over-drawing my account
So that I don't get in trouble with the bank.

The error response from the bank should be

```json
{"error": "insufficient-funds"}
```

Title: Carts should be CRUD-able
Description:
As a purchaser
I want to be able to manage my own cart
So that I don't have to share with my sister

Title: Receipts contain product information (name and price)
Description:
As a purchaser
I want to see product information in my receipts
So I can see all the wonderful things I've bought

Title: The purchase API does not work on Prod
Description:
```
$ curl gobanking-purchase.cfapps.pez.pivotal.io/checkout -d'{"account_id": 1}'
502 Bad Gateway: Registered endpoint failed to handle the request.
```

Title: Products are searchable
Description:
As a purchaser
I want to search for products
So that I don't have to know what I'm looking for to find it.

Add ability to search on tags, description, name

```
/products?q=<some query>
```

Title: Products have inventory
Description:
As a warehouse operator
I want to manage product inventory
So that I don't have unhappy customers when I can't fulfill an order

Title: Transfer funds to another bank
Description:
As a user
I want to be able to transfer funds to another user
So that they can do the shopping for me.

```
POST /banks/13/transfer 
{"recipient_id": 12, "amount": {"money": 9.33, "currency": "USD"}}
```

Title: Add ability to place a hold against a bank
Description:
As a user
I want to place holds against banks
So that multiple transactions cannot be made at one time against the same bank
